Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/5/18. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and ISEP requirements.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
James B. Gale, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
This is not a DHHS contracted agency.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following: The agency does not have
a DHHS contract.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Renewal inspection 7/10/18
The renewal inspection found the following rule violation.
Three of eight adoption evaluations were completed in excess of 90 from the date of
the application. One report was completed in 120 days and two reports were
completed in 150 days. The delays were primarily due to the applicants not providing
required documents timely. A corrective action plan was implemented.
This interim inspection reviewed 5 of 12 home studies completed by the agency.
These home studies were completed within 90 days from the date of the application.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
